items.sentence: Stand over there and you\'ll be able to see it better.
I haven\'t heard that song since I was in high school.
Mary isn\'t really sick. She\'s only pretending to be.
If it weren\'t for her help, I would not be alive now.
Let\'s find a solution that is acceptable to everyone.
It is dangerous for children to go out alone at night.
It was a fine day and there were no clouds in the sky.
This information isn\'t as up-to-date as it should be.
The police found Tom\'s fingerprints in Mary\'s house.
It wasn\'t until I got home that I missed my umbrella.
It wasn\'t until yesterday that I found out the truth.
It\'s bad manners to eat on trains and buses in Japan.
It\'s like a weight has been lifted from my shoulders.
I haven\'t eaten since breakfast and I\'m very hungry.
It was raining hard when Tom arrived at Mary\'s house.
It wasn\'t as simple as we thought it was going to be.
It wasn\'t easy for me to write this letter in French.
I can\'t believe you don\'t want to at least meet Tom.
I doubt that Tom understands what I tried to tell him.
Tom was so drunk that he couldn\'t even open the door.
